author: Michael Larabel
description: A patch series posted today for Nouveau, the open-source NVIDIA kernel driver within the mainline Linux tree, can help overcome some performance obstacles currently observed with the Mesa NVK Vulkan driver...
title: Important Patch Series For Nouveau Driver Will Help With NVK Performance

author: Michael Larabel
description: The PCI subsystem updates were merged today for the in-development Linux 6.18 kernel. The PCI changes this cycle are mostly a random assortment of different changes to the wide assortment of PCIe drivers. Standing out is a workaround for dealing with a possible PCI Express performance issue for latest-generation Xeon 6 servers...
title: Linux 6.18 Works Around An Intel Xeon 6 PCIe Performance Issue

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Rust-written Redox operating system written from scratch is now enabling multi-threaded support by default for x86-based systems...
title: Rust-Written Redox OS Enables Multi-Threading By Default

author: Michael Larabel
description: Ubuntu 25.10 is looking quite nice in the performance department ahead of its official release later this week. On various systems tested thus far, Ubuntu 25.10 is delivering nice gains over Ubuntu 25.04 and compared to the current Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. The latest Ubuntu 25.10 benchmarking at Phoronix is looking at the Intel Core Ultra Lunar Lake performance using the Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon Gen 13 Aura Edition laptop.
title: Ubuntu 25.10 Delivering Some Nice Performance Gains For Intel Core Ultra "Lunar Lake"

author: Michael Larabel
description: While the Intel In-Memory Analytics Accelerator (IAA) so far is just found on newer Xeon server processors, prior Linux patches acknowledge IAA being found on at least select Panther Lake SoCs. New patches ready for merging to the Linux 6.18 kernel are indicating IAA accelerator(s) will also be found on at least some of the lower-cost Wildcat Lake SoCs too...
title: Linux Preps IAA Accelerator Support For Intel's Wildcat Lake

author: Michael Larabel
description: The networking subsytem updates for Linux 6.18 have been merged. There is a lot of enticing performance optimizations in different areas of the networking stack for this new kernel. Plus new wired and wireless networking hardware support and other improvements to get excited about for this LTS kernel version...
title: Many Networking Performance Improvements & New Hardware In Linux 6.18

author: Michael Larabel
description: At the start of the year, a new GCC compiler front-end was proposed for the half-century old ALGOL 68 programming language. Not exactly a popular programming language in recent decades and ahead of the GCC 15 release it was decided to not merge it yet to GCC. Even with that setback, development on the ALGOL 68 GCC compiler continues...
title: ALGOL 68 Programming Language Support Still Being Worked On For GCC

author: Michael Larabel
description: The x86 platform drivers area of the Linux kernel continues to see a lot of code churn for supporting new laptops and enhancing support for existing laptop models. Plus the likes of AMD PMF and Intel PMC continue to see ongoing improvements too...
title: Linux 6.18 Adds Two New x86 Platform Drivers, New AMD PMF Capabilities

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Intel Trust Domain Extensions (TDX) updates for the Linux 6.18 kernel allow it to work with Kexec for being able to load and boot into a new kernel from another currently running kernel...
title: Intel TDX Will Now Work With Linux's Kexec - Except For Early CPUs With Known Bug

author: Michael Larabel
description: The VFIO subsystem updates were merged last week for the ongoing Linux 6.18 merge window...
title: VFIO Platform Driver Saved From Removal, NVIDIA GB300 Support Added
